marketNews.title: Hal lain yang lagi hot yang perlu kamu ketahui...
marketNews.content: Governor of Bank Indonesia, Perry Warjiyo, stated on Wednesday (11/12) that Bank Indonesia projects Indonesia's economic growth in 2026 to reach +5.3% YoY, lower than the 2026 State Budget target of +5.4% YoY. Nevertheless, Perry mentioned that economic growth in 2026 could still reach +5.4% YoY if the government accelerates fiscal spending. For 2025, Bank Indonesia forecasts economic growth to be at +5.1% YoY, unchanged from the previous projection. Meanwhile, credit growth in 2026 is projected to be in the range of +8-12% YoY, compared to the 2025 target range of +8-11% YoY. Regarding the exchange rate, Bank Indonesia projects the average rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar will be at the level of 16,440 in 2025 and 16,430 in 2026. Bank Indonesia also projects average inflation to reach 2.01% YoY in 2025 and 2.62% YoY in 2026. Chairman of Gapki, Eddy Martono, told Bloomberg that palm oil prices could reach 5,000 Ringgit per ton in 1H26 if the government continues the discourse on implementing a 50% biodiesel mixture or B50. The implementation of B50 can depress Indonesian palm oil exports. Secretary General of Gapki, M. Hadi Sugeng Wahyudiono, mentioned that the implementation of B50 has the potential to cut Indonesia's total palm oil exports to 26 million tons in 2026, down from this year's estimate of 31 million tons. Previously, the Minister of EMR, Bahlil Lahadalia, said in October 2025 that the government plans to implement B50 in 2H26 and is considering the option of implementing a domestic market obligation (DMO) on palm oil to maintain the supply for the B50 program.

marketNews.title: Kombinasi Rasio Keuangan yang Bikin Analisa Makin Tajam
marketNews.content: The best insights often come not from a single number, but from the relationship between numbers. - parahitairawan

tickerNews.title: Merdeka Copper Gold and MBMA Operational Performance Data for 9M25
tickerNews.content: Merdeka Copper Gold (MDKA) and Merdeka Battery Materials (MBMA) have announced their operational performance data for 9M25 [see table]. Here are some important points from this operational performance update. - All commodities experienced quarterly production volume increases, resulting in increased quarterly sales volume in 3Q25. Cumulatively during 9M25, the production volume of all commodities recorded performance relatively in line with the 2025 guidance revised in 1H25. - MBMA also conveyed that the company resumed nickel matte production in 4Q25 after obtaining a contract with favorable economic terms. Previously, nickel matte production was halted since 1Q25 due to thin margins. - MDKA's subsidiary, Merdeka Gold Resources (EMAS), announced that it has commenced mining activities since October 1, 2025, with the first ore stacking scheduled for November 2025. Furthermore, the Pani project construction is proceeding on schedule, with overall completion reaching 83%. First gold production is targeted for 1Q26.

tickerNews.title: MDKA and MBMA Potential for Quarterly Operating Profit Increase in 3Q25
tickerNews.content: Based on the 9M25 operational performance data, MDKA and MBMA have the potential to record quarterly operating profit increases in 3Q25. MBMA's quarterly performance increase is driven by the rising sales volume trend of limonite ore and nickel pig iron, followed by an increase in the cash margin for both products due to cost efficiencies. Meanwhile, in addition to the increase in sales volume and cash margin from the nickel business, MDKA's performance improvement is also driven by an increase in gold sales volume (+30% QoQ), although the gold segment's cash margin slightly decreased (-4% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: BUMI Reportedly Expanding Business into Bauxite and Alumina
tickerNews.content: BUMI: Bloomberg Technoz reported that Bumi Resources will acquire a 45% stake in bauxite mining company PT Laman Mining from PT Supreme Global Investment for US$59.1 million or approximately IDR 985 billion. BUMI Advisor, Christopher Fong, told Bloomberg Technoz that the acquisition of PT Laman Mining is an effort by the company to diversify its mineral business into the bauxite and alumina portfolio. Bloomberg Technoz mentioned that BUMI will also acquire a 55% stake in a subsidiary of PT Laman Mining, PT Supreme Alumina Indonesia, which is developing an alumina plant project. The President Director of PT Laman Mining, Agustinus Tan, told Bloomberg Technoz that PT Supreme Alumina Indonesia is preparing an alumina plant valued at approximately US$1.5 billion or ~IDR 25 trillion, with construction targeted for 2Q26 and commercial operation targeted one year after the construction period. The project is targeted to produce 2.4 million tons of alumina per year, with an input capacity of around 7.9 million tons of bauxite per year.

tickerNews.title: GOTO Clarification to IDX Regarding EGM Agenda and Media Reports on Escrow Fund
tickerNews.content: GOTO: GoTo Gojek Tokopedia in a clarification to the IDX stated that the agenda for the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (EGMS) will be submitted on November 25, 2025, after thorough review by the board of directors, board of commissioners, and all stakeholders. GOTO also explained that media reports mentioning an escrow fund of US$300 million in Singapore related to rumors of a buyout of GOTO shares owned by Telkomsel - a subsidiary of Telkom Indonesia (TLKM) - are untrue and misleading.

tickerNews.title: Archi Indonesia Shareholder PT Basis Utama Prima Sold Stake
tickerNews.content: ARCI: Archi Indonesia shareholder, PT Basis Utama Prima, sold approximately 1.52 billion (6.12%) of ARCI shares, based on the monthly statement of securities registration as of October 31, 2025. After this transaction, the ownership portion of PT Basis Utama Prima in ARCI decreased from 6.12% to zero, while public ownership increased from 8.88% to 15%. Based on KSEI data, PT Basis Utama Prima has been selling ARCI shares since October 2, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Pakuan (UANG) Announces Share Purchase by Hapsoro from Controlling Shareholder
tickerNews.content: UANG: Pakuan announced that Hapsoro has purchased approximately 234.2 million UANG shares from the company's controller, PT Sirius Surya Sentosa, at an average price of 467 Rupiah per share on November 7, 2025. The transaction price was lower by about -78.5% compared to the UANG stock price at the closing of the exchange on the same day. The total transaction value reached approximately IDR 109.4 billion. After this transaction, Hapsoro's direct ownership portion in UANG increased from zero to 19.35%, while the direct ownership portion of PT Sirius Surya Sentosa decreased from 60.35% to 41%.

tickerNews.title: PTPP Plans Divestment of Stakes in PT PP Infrastruktur and PT Celebes Railway Indonesia
tickerNews.content: PTPP: PT PP plans to divest 81% of its share ownership in PT PP Infrastruktur to a non-affiliate party, PT Varsha Zamindo Laksana, for approximately IDR 1.4 trillion. After this transaction is completed, PTPP's ownership portion in PT PP Infrastruktur will decrease from 99.15% to 18.15%. In addition, PTPP also plans to divest 47.81% of its share ownership in PT Celebes Railway Indonesia to a non-affiliate party, PT Solra Energi Terbarukan, for approximately IDR 282.1 billion. After this transaction is completed, PTPP will have no ownership in PT Celebes Railway Indonesia. Both transaction plans are part of PTPP's strategy to restructure its business portfolio to allow it to focus more on its core business. This plan will be discussed in the EGMS on December 18, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Chandra Asri Pacific's JV Aster Allocates US$2 Billion for Singapore Investments
tickerNews.content: TPIA: Chandra Asri Pacific Director, Andre Khor, stated that Aster Chemicals and Energy Pte Ltd - a joint venture between TPIA and Glencore - will allocate US$2 billion to invest in Singapore. The funds will be used to acquire the Esso petrol station network in Singapore from ExxonMobil, develop assets on Pulau Bukom and Pulau Jurong, and build a green aviation fuel (green avtur) production facility. For the development of green avtur, Aster will cooperate with Aether Fuels. The project will produce up to 50 barrels of fuel per day, with project construction in 2026 and targeted commercial operation in 2028.

tickerNews.title: Sarana Mitra Luas (SMIL) Targets IDR 600 Billion Revenue in 2026, Relying on Recurring Income
tickerNews.content: SMIL: Sarana Mitra Luas President Director, Hadi Suhermin, stated that the company targets revenue of IDR 600 billion in 2026, an increase of approximately +33-39% YoY from the 2025 target in the range of IDR 432-450 billion. Hadi explained that this target is based on the potential recurring income from heavy equipment rental services in the coal mining sector. Previously, SMIL expanded its business line to the mining sector in Painan, West Sumatra through a joint operation scheme with a number of strategic partners under the umbrella of PT Sarana Cipta Minergi, as well as partnering with PT Barakara and PT ATOZ as mining business license holders. In this mining project, SMIL acts as the main heavy equipment provider. That mine is targeted to have an initial production capacity of 200,000 tons per month, with the potential to increase production capacity up to 500,000 tons per month.

tickerNews.title: Barito Renewables Energy (BREN) Allocates CAPEX of ~250 Million USD in 2026 for Geothermal Projects
tickerNews.content: Director of Barito Renewables Energy (BREN), Hsing Chee Chiam, stated that the company will allocate CAPEX of approximately US$250 million in 2026, higher than the 2025 CAPEX allocation of approximately US$210 million (compared to 9M25 CAPEX realization: approximately US$100 million). The majority of this budget will be allocated for the construction of the Wayang Windu Geothermal Power Plant Unit 3 of 30 MW and the Salak Geothermal Power Plant Unit 7 of 40 MW, both of which are targeted to operate in 4Q26.

tickerNews.title: Barito Pacific (BRPT) Has No Immediate Plan to IPO PT Griya Idola or Acquire NRCA
tickerNews.content: Director of Barito Pacific (BRPT), David Kosasih, stated in a public exposition on Wednesday (12/11) that the company does not currently plan to bring PT Griya Idola for an IPO in the near future. David mentioned that PT Griya Idola is currently focusing on developing its existing business and will only conduct an IPO when the company is truly ready. David also affirmed that there is no acquisition plan by PT Griya Idola for Nusa Raya Cipta (NRCA) to strengthen its property business.

tickerNews.title: Budi Starch & Sweetener (BUDI) to Distribute Interim Dividend for 2025 Fiscal Year
tickerNews.content: Budi Starch & Sweetener (BUDI) will distribute an interim dividend for the 2025 fiscal year amounting to approximately IDR 31.4 billion or 7 Rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of approximately 3% as of Wednesday (12/11). The cum-dividend date in the regular and negotiated market is November 20, 2025, while payment will be made on December 11, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Master Print (PTMR) Announces Conditional Agreement for Acquisition by Singapore Investment Firm
tickerNews.content: Master Print (PTMR) announced that Deep Source Pte. Ltd. - an investment company from Singapore - has signed a conditional agreement to acquire PTMR from the existing controller, Mitra Pack (PTMP). The total transaction value and completion time have not yet been announced. After this transaction is completed, Deep Source Pte. Ltd. will become the new controller of PTMR.
